Key Arguments: The submission argues against censorship of opinions, emphasizing the importance of free speech in a democracy.
It criticizes the handling of COVID-19 information, claiming that fact-checkers and government officials censored expert opinions and promoted misinformation.
The submission highlights conflicts of interest and lack of transparency in the government's COVID-19 response, particularly regarding vaccine safety and effectiveness.
It argues that government narratives have led to discrimination and job losses for unvaccinated individuals and frontline workers.
The submission expresses distrust in the government's ability to arbitrate truth, citing past instances of misinformation and suppression of alternative viewpoints.
It warns against the dangers of government-controlled censorship, drawing parallels to historical examples of book burning and suppression of dissent.
Main Themes: Misinformation and disinformation in public health
Notable Quotes: Truth, no matter how unpalatable, is truth!
Suppressing the truth is as good as lying.
Censorship is a very dangerous power in the wrong hands. AUSTRALIANS CANNOT AFFORD THAT RISK!
